description: Borrowed from Ancient Greek ἀδελφικός (adelphikós, “brotherly”), from ἀδελφός (adelphós, “brother”); synchronically, adelpho- +‎ -ic.

adjectives.description: adelphic (comparative more adelphic, superlative most adelphic)

entries.meaning: Describing a form of polyandry in which a woman is married to two or more brothers
